title: RawVec growth strategy can be more efficient
body:
Currently, the RawVec implementation tries to double its internal capacity every time it has to grow, as can be seen in: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/31a4f2da575f5e335bdbbe7f12a694f9e74ad0a1/library/alloc/src/raw_vec.rs#L398

But, according to [Facebook's FBVector memory handling](https://github.com/facebook/folly/blob/main/folly/docs/FBVector.md#memory-handling): it is suboptimal, as "[it can be mathematically proven that a growth factor of 2 is rigorously the worst possible because it never allows the vector to reuse any of its previously-allocated memory](https://github.com/facebook/folly/blob/main/folly/docs/FBVector.md#memory-handling:~:text=it%20can%20be%20mathematically%20proven%20that%20a%20growth%20factor%20of%202%20is%20rigorously%20the%20worst%20possible%20because%20it%20never%20allows%20the%20vector%20to%20reuse%20any%20of%20its%20previously%2Dallocated%20memory)" because ["any new chunk requested will be larger than all previously used chunks combined, so the vector must crawl forward in memory; it can't move back to its deallocated chunks. But any number smaller than 2 guarantees that you'll at some point be able to reuse the previous chunks."](https://github.com/facebook/folly/blob/main/folly/docs/FBVector.md#memory-handling:~:text=any%20new%20chunk%20requested%20will%20be%20larger%20than%20all%20previously%20used%20chunks%20combined%2C%20so%20the%20vector%20must%20crawl%20forward%20in%20memory%3B%20it%20can%27t%20move%20back%20to%20its%20deallocated%20chunks.%20But%20any%20number%20smaller%20than%202%20guarantees%20that%20you%27ll%20at%20some%20point%20be%20able%20to%20reuse%20the%20previous%20chunks.)

They use [a growth factor of 1.5](https://github.com/facebook/folly/blob/main/folly/docs/FBVector.md#memory-handling:~:text=fbvector%20uses%20a%20growth%20factor%20of%201.5).

Maybe it is worth considering changing the growth factor for the standard library to a theoretically more optimal value.
